intro: Conostylis juncea, commonly known as the slender bracted grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Its flowers are usually pale green or brown and are arranged in dense, compact clusters. Conostylis juncea is a hardy species that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
